rules: Rule1: If a user is authorized for a device, then the device has emergency access.
Rule2: Whenever a user is authorized for a device, the device is registered.
Rule3: Either a user is authorized for a device or a global exception applies to the device.
Rule4: Provided that an admin performs an admin override, then if the device has emergency access, it is compliant.
Rule5: Under the condition that a device has a policy exception, if it has emergency access, then it is compliant.
Rule6: Either there is a maintenance window at a time or a security incident occurs at that time.
Rule7: Provided that a security incident occurs at a time, the device has a policy exception.
Rule8: Whenever a user has temporary authorization, the device is authenticated.
Rule9: Either a security audit is conducted at a time or a compliance check is performed at that time.
Rule10: If a compliance check is performed at a time, then provided that a user is authorized for the device, the user has temporary authorization.
Rule11: Whenever an access review is conducted at a time, an access log is maintained for the device.
Rule12: Provided that an audit is scheduled at a time, if a security audit is conducted at that time, then an access review is conducted.
Rule13: Either an admin performs a manual override or an audit is scheduled at a time.
Rule14: If a device is new, then it is unregistered.
Rule15: Provided that a quarantine policy applies to a device, if the device is unregistered, then it is not blocked.
Rule16: Either a quarantine policy applies to a device or a security alert is triggered for the device.
Rule17: Whenever threat detection is performed by a system, if a security alert is triggered for a device, then provided that the device is unregistered, it is not blocked.
Rule18: Either threat detection is performed by a system or an automated response is executed by a system.
Rule19: Whenever an automated response is executed by a system, a security system is in place.
Rule20: If a device is authenticated, then it is connected to the network.
Rule21: Under the condition that an isolation protocol is activated for a device, if a security alert is triggered for the device, then provided that the device is unregistered, it is not blocked.
Rule22: If a security system is in place, then protection is active for the system.
Rule23: Whenever protection is active for a system, an isolation protocol is activated for the device.
Rule24: If a device is compliant, then it is authenticated.
Rule25: Provided that a device is registered, it is compliant.
Rule26: Either a device is blocked or a global exception applies to the device.
Rule27: If a device is suspicious, then it is not blocked.
Rule28: Under the condition that an investigation is conducted on a device, if the device is not suspicious, then it is monitored.
Rule29: If it is not the case that a maintenance window implies an admin override, then normal operation takes place at that time.
Rule30: If it is not the case that the negation of a maintenance window implying an admin override leads to no normal operation, then extended maintenance occurs at that time.
Rule31: Provided that a device is not suspicious, it is not monitored.
facts: Fact2: An investigation is conducted on a device.
Fact3: Extended maintenance does not occur at a time.
Fact4: An access log is not maintained for a device.
Fact5: A device is not connected to a network.
Fact6: An admin does not perform a manual override.

question: A global exception applies to a device.
